definition: to press down/to calm/to subdue/to suppress/to guard/garrison/small town/to cool or chill (food or drinks)
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
Campaign to Suppress Counterrevolutionaries (PRC political campaign from 1950-1952), abbr. to 鎮反運動|镇反运动[Zhen4 fan3 Yun4 dong4]
pinyin: Zhen4 ya1 Fan3 ge2 ming4 Yun4 dong4

sentences.english: At last the rebellion was crushed down.
During this period of 6 years, he quelled the nationalities' Risingup in Yunnan successfully.
sentences.chinese: 其間，他成功地鎮壓了滇東北各族人民起義。

sentences.english: Khomeini’s regime responded with remarkable brutality, slaughtering thousands of the organization’s members.
sentences.chinese: 霍梅尼政權殘忍的鎮壓遊行，屠殺了幾千名組織成員。

sentences.english: The Syrian government launched a violent campaign against pro-democracy protesters in March.
sentences.chinese: 敘利亞政府三月份對主張民主的示威者展開暴力鎮壓。

sentences.english: The political repression in this country is imposed by severe fear.
sentences.chinese: 這個國家的政治鎮壓是通過恐怖行動來實施的。

sentences.english: The riot police started to crack down on them.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察開始對他們採取鎮壓行動。

sentences.english: Finally the Northwest Army's suppressing the Heavenly Gate Society marked the Red Spears' falling.
sentences.chinese: 西北軍對天門會的鎮壓標誌着紅槍會的衰亡。

sentences.english: Indian Defense Minister Arackaparambil Kurian Antony says that has ramifications on this side of the border.
sentences.chinese: 印度國防部長安東尼說，這些鎮壓對印度也有影響。

sentences.english: Gradually the Government was systematized and lawlessness suppressed.
sentences.chinese: 政府漸漸地變得系統化和非法地鎮壓。

sentences.english: The Syrian government is continuing its crackdown Monday against anti-government protesters.
sentences.chinese: 敘利亞政府正在繼續鎮壓反日反政府示威者。

sentences.english: It is actually reflection of this view that she cruelly kept down the Movement of 1898.
sentences.chinese: 她殘酷地鎮壓戊戌變法運動就是這一基本思想的反映。

sentences.english: The military and civil authorities are working together to put down the unrest.
sentences.chinese: 軍政和民政當局正聯手鎮壓動亂。

sentences.english: Their subjugation became a pillar of the Islamic state.
sentences.chinese: 對她們的鎮壓成爲這個伊斯蘭國家的一個支柱。

sentences.english: This argument is only too blatantly an alibi for domestic repression.
sentences.chinese: 這一辯解完全是在爲國內的鎮壓活動開脫。

sentences.english: The murderer was executed according to law.
sentences.chinese: 那個殺人犯已經依法鎮壓了。

sentences.english: The reactionaries crushed the movement of the students into submission.
sentences.chinese: 反動派鎮壓了學生運動。

definition: to encircle and annihilate/refers to repeated campaigns of the Guomindang against the communists from 1930 onwards
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to start/to launch/to unleash/to mobilize/to arouse
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to drive (vehicle)/to drive out/to chase away/to herd (people towards a gate)
to cut off/to chop sth in half
